html: dry up the sea/rivers a wilderness/fish to stink/waters are dried up/clothe the heavens with blackness. The Lord uses these as examples of his power. These phrases may refer to drought and to the smoke of war (which, although perpetrated by man, can also be a judgment of God) that obscures the sky, and they remind us of the miracles of Moses in Egypt (Ex. 7:18-21; 10:21; 14:26). They may also refer not only to events of the past but also to the Second Coming, an event of the future (Rev. 6:12; 8:12; D&C 45:42; 133:66). The Lord gave the same prophecy through Jeremiah (Jer. 51:36). Just as the Lord has great power over the elements, so also does he have power to redeem and deliver.
